document_data.name: Bleached Bones Pass
document_data.mainbody: The '''Bleached Bones Pass''', previously known as the '''Vale of Naurogloth''' or simply '''Naurogloth''', was an ancient route that wound through the [[Greypeak Mountains]] within the [[Fallen Lands]] of the [[Savage Frontier]]. It was named for the end seemingly endless piles of sun-bleached bones that littered its length though the mountains.
document_data.Description: It was a narrow, saddle-shaped pathway carved through the mountains, ideal for predators or hunters to ambush their prey.
document_data.History:
During the [[Age of Humanity]], and for some centuries before, the Vale of Naurogloth as it was known marked the southern border of the fabled [[dwarven]] kingdom of [[Ammarindar (kingdom)|Ammarindar]]. In that same era, it linked the [[Netherese]] city of [[Dekanter]] with the [[elven]] realm of [[Illefarn]] to the west.

In the 11{{th}} century [[DR]], the ''[[Spellbook of Daimos]]'' was recovered from within the pass by a caravan master named [[Muirhar|Muirhar "Duskbrow"]] after [[gnoll]]s unsuccessfully ambushed his wagon train.

When the [[phaerimm]] escaped from behind the [[Sharn Wall]] in the {{YearlinkName|1371}}, they raised an army from those that dwelled within the Greypeaks. Within half a [[tenday]] of their released, the phaerimm's enthralled [[mind flayer]]s overran the Bleached Bone Pass.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: It was rumored by some that at least one [[shadow dragon]] was known to haunt the Bleached Bone Pass.
document_data.Notable Locations: While not situated within its route, the ancient dwarfhold of [[Citadel Yaunoroth]] was built into one of the Greypeaks that directly overlooked the pass.
document_data.Inhabitants: Throughout history, this pass through the Greypeak Mountains was home to great many [[orc]]s.
